main event: Sgt. Francis Young, a ground aircraft observer, reported observing six bright objects maneuvering for approximately twelve minutes at a very high altitude. The observation was verified by another airman.
interesting points: The objects were reported to be flying in formation and scattered at the same time.
The objects were observed by ground aircraft spotters at the Harrisburg Filter Center and appeared to be descending, becoming brighter in color, and then fading out of sight.
There was no sound or exhaust noted from the objects.
Ceiling and visibility were unlimited at the time of the observation.
The observation was independently verified by another unidentified airman.
sighted object: six bright objects at a very high altitude
witnesses: Sgt. Francis Young, another unidentified airman, ground aircraft spotters
